title: SynDelay: A Synthetic Dataset for Delivery Delay Prediction
optimized_headline: "Discover SynDelay: A New Dataset for Predicting Delivery Delays"

raw_body:
arXiv:2509.05325v1 Announce Type: new 
Abstract: Artificial intelligence (AI) is transforming supply chain management, yet progress in predictive tasks -- such as delivery delay prediction -- remains constrained by the scarcity of high-quality, openly available datasets. Existing datasets are often proprietary, small, or inconsistently maintained, hindering reproducibility and benchmarking. We present SynDelay, a synthetic dataset designed for delivery delay prediction. Generated using an advanced generative model trained on real-world data, SynDelay preserves realistic delivery patterns while ensuring privacy. Although not entirely free of noise or inconsistencies, it provides a challenging and practical testbed for advancing predictive modelling. To support adoption, we provide baseline results and evaluation metrics as initial benchmarks, serving as reference points rather than state-of-the-art claims. SynDelay is publicly available through the Supply Chain Data Hub, an open initiative promoting dataset sharing and benchmarking in supply chain AI. We encourage the community to contribute datasets, models, and evaluation practices to advance research in this area. All code is openly accessible at https://supplychaindatahub.org.
speedrun: Researchers have introduced SynDelay, a synthetic dataset aimed at improving delivery delay predictions in supply chain management. This dataset uses a generative model trained on real-world data to maintain realistic delivery patterns while ensuring privacy. With existing datasets often being small or proprietary, SynDelay fills a critical gap. Its public availability could enhance reproducibility and benchmarking in AI-driven supply chain solutions, making it a timely resource for researchers and practitioners alike.
why_it_matters: This dataset could significantly benefit supply chain managers by providing reliable data for forecasting delivery delays, improving operational efficiency.
On a broader scale, SynDelay represents a shift towards more open and accessible data in the AI community, encouraging collaboration and innovation.

lenses.eli12: SynDelay is like a virtual training ground for teaching AI how to predict delivery delays. It uses smart algorithms to create realistic scenarios while keeping personal data safe. This matters because better predictions can help businesses run smoother and save money.
lenses.pm: For product managers, SynDelay offers a valuable resource for understanding and predicting delivery timelines. By leveraging this dataset, they could enhance user experience and reduce costs associated with delays. It also encourages collaboration within the industry, leading to more robust solutions.
lenses.engineer: From a technical perspective, SynDelay is generated using an advanced generative model, which ensures that the dataset reflects realistic delivery patterns. While it may contain some noise, it serves as a practical benchmark for testing predictive models. The dataset is publicly accessible, promoting transparency and community engagement in AI research.
